Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : pos ?n, pos_nxt x = pos_nxt y ->...-> i = 1 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 0 \/ i = 2 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 (3 + lP) \/ i = 3 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 (2 + lP) R_no_self_loops : mm_no_self_loops (1 + lP, R) Q := g (1 + lP) 1 P ++ R : list (mm_instr (pos (S n))) Q_no_self_loops : mm_no_self_loops (1, Q) j : nat ρ : mm_instr (pos n) |- nat]
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [n : nat f := fun (k i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) => match ρ with | INCₐ x => INCₐ (pos_nxt x) | DECₐ x j => DECₐ (pos_nxt x) (if Nat.eq_dec i j then 1 + k else if le_lt_dec k j then 0 else j) end : nat -> nat -> mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_instr (pos (S n)) g := fix g (k i : nat) P {struct P} : list (mm_instr (pos (S n))) := match P with | nil => nil | ρ :: P0 => f k i ρ :: g k (S i) P0 end : nat -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n))...
Fin.caseS' : forall (p : pos (S ?n)) (P0 : pos (S ?n) -> Type), P0 pos0 -> (forall p0 : pos ?n, P0 (pos_nxt p0)) ->...-> i = 1 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 0 \/ i = 2 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 (3 + lP) \/ i = 3 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 (2 + lP) R_no_self_loops : mm_no_self_loops (1 + lP, R) Q := g (1 + lP) 1 P ++ R : list (mm_instr (pos (S n))) Q_no_self_loops : mm_no_self_loops (1, Q) j : nat ρ : mm_instr (pos n) |- nat]
mm_self_loop_no_term_2 : forall (n : nat) (P : list (mm_instr (pos n))) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (s : nat * vec nat n) (v : vec nat n), (i, DECₐ x (1 + i) :: DECₐ x i :: nil) <sc (1, P) -> s = (i, v) \/ s = (1 + i, v) -> v#>x = 0 -> ~ (1, P) // s ↓
mm_steps_DEC_1_inv : forall (n k : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat) (st : nat * vec nat n), (i, DECₐ x p :: nil) <sc P -> k <> 0 -> v#>x = S u -> P // (i, v) -[k] -> st -> exists k' : nat, k' < k /\ P // (1 + i, v[u/x]) -[k'] -> st

```coq
intros.
apply mm_steps_DEC_1_inv in H.
- destruct H as [k' [Hk' Hstep]].
  apply subcode_g in Hstep.
  destruct Hstep as [rho' [Hsub Hrho']].
  apply (g_subcode 1) in Hsub.
  apply sc_R_1 in Hsub.
  apply (Tauto.D j (f (1 + lP) j rho) pos0 0  (3 + lP) (2 + lP)) in Hsub.
  destruct Hsub; subst.
  + apply sc_R_2.
  + apply sc_R_2.
  + apply sc_R_2.
- apply lt_neq. auto.
- destruct H. reflexivity.
Qed.
```

original: intros. apply mm_steps_DEC_1_inv in H. - destruct H as [k' [Hk' Hstep]]. apply subcode_g in Hstep. destruct Hstep as [rho' [Hsub Hrho']]. apply (g_subcode 1) in Hsub. apply sc_R_1 in Hsub. apply (Tauto.D j (f (1 + lP) j rho) pos0 0 (3 + lP) (2 + lP)) in Hsub. destruct Hsub; subst. + apply sc_R_2. + apply sc_R_2. + apply sc_R_2. - apply lt_neq. auto. - destruct H. reflexivity.
